resources.string: Physics Engine used for simulating the world
How bouncy the object is: 1.0 (100) implies perfect elasticity, 0.0 implies complete rigidity
Force of resistance of an object when moving across another: 0.0 implies no friction, 1.0 (100) implies high friction
Density measured in (10^1 kg/m^3). Varies mostly within 30 â€“ 80 (Balsa ~16, Teak ~90)
Density measured in (10^2 kg/m^3). Aluminium ~26, Titanium ~45, Iron ~79, Lead ~113, Platinum ~215
How much the simulation time should be slowed down (default: 1x = no slowdown)
Number of floors of the wooden plank tower structure
Place a structure first and only after then you can hurdle a ball. Use the icons below.
Settings cannot be changed once simulation is started. Clear the scene with the leftmost icon.

Leftmost icon clears the scene of any previous simulations. The cog icon allows simulation parameter tuning. The building icon places a wooden plank structure to the crosshair center. The rightmost icon hurdles a ball towards the corsshair center.
Place a tower first before hurdling a ball
Please clear the scene before trying to place structure again.
Try to aim at the tower
Wait until locked in: bright green dot in the center
Plank tower simulation: place a plank tower structure and then hurdle a ball at it
Collision box simulation: move around a cylinder to stir planks in a collision box
